6// This class contains prototypes for representing GLES 3 Vertex Array Objects:
7//
8// The buffer objects that are to be used by the vertex stage of the GL are collected
9// together to form a vertex array object. All state related to the definition of data used
10// by the vertex processor is encapsulated in a vertex array object.
11//
12
13#ifndef LIBANGLE_VERTEXARRAY_H_
14#define LIBANGLE_VERTEXARRAY_H_
15
16#include "common/Optional.h"
17#include "libANGLE/Constants.h"
18#include "libANGLE/Debug.h"
19#include "libANGLE/Observer.h"
20#include "libANGLE/RefCountObject.h"
21#include "libANGLE/VertexAttribute.h"
22
23#include <vector>
24
25namespace rx
26{
27class GLImplFactory;
28class VertexArrayImpl;
29} // namespace rx
30
31namespace gl
32{
33class Buffer;
34
35class VertexArrayState final : angle::NonCopyable
36{
37 public:
38 VertexArrayState(VertexArray *vertexArray, size_t maxAttribs, size_t maxBindings);
39 ~VertexArrayState();
40
41 const std::string &getLabel() const { return mLabel; }
42
43 Buffer *getElementArrayBuffer() const { return mElementArrayBuffer.get(); }
44 size_t getMaxAttribs() const { return mVertexAttributes.size(); }
45 size_t getMaxBindings() const { return mVertexBindings.size(); }
46 const AttributesMask &getEnabledAttributesMask() const { return mEnabledAttributesMask; }
47 const std::vector<VertexAttribute> &getVertexAttributes() const { return mVertexAttributes; }
48 const VertexAttribute &getVertexAttribute(size_t attribIndex) const
49 {
50 return mVertexAttributes[attribIndex];
51 }
52 const std::vector<VertexBinding> &getVertexBindings() const { return mVertexBindings; }
53 const VertexBinding &getVertexBinding(size_t bindingIndex) const
54 {
55 return mVertexBindings[bindingIndex];
56 }
57 const VertexBinding &getBindingFromAttribIndex(size_t attribIndex) const
58 {
59 return mVertexBindings[mVertexAttributes[attribIndex].bindingIndex];
60 }
61 size_t getBindingIndexFromAttribIndex(size_t attribIndex) const
62 {
63 return mVertexAttributes[attribIndex].bindingIndex;
64 }
65
66 void setAttribBinding(const Context *context, size_t attribIndex, GLuint newBindingIndex);
67
68 // Extra validation performed on the Vertex Array.
69 bool hasEnabledNullPointerClientArray() const;
70
71 // Get all the attributes in an AttributesMask that are using the given binding.
72 AttributesMask getBindingToAttributesMask(GLuint bindingIndex) const;
73
74 ComponentTypeMask getVertexAttributesTypeMask() const { return mVertexAttributesTypeMask; }
75
76 AttributesMask getClientMemoryAttribsMask() const { return mClientMemoryAttribsMask; }
77
78 gl::AttributesMask getNullPointerClientMemoryAttribsMask() const
79 {
80 return mNullPointerClientMemoryAttribsMask;
81 }
82
83 private:
84 friend class VertexArray;
85 std::string mLabel;
86 std::vector<VertexAttribute> mVertexAttributes;
87 SubjectBindingPointer<Buffer> mElementArrayBuffer;
88 std::vector<VertexBinding> mVertexBindings;
89 AttributesMask mEnabledAttributesMask;
90 ComponentTypeMask mVertexAttributesTypeMask;
91
92 // This is a performance optimization for buffer binding. Allows element array buffer updates.
93 friend class State;
94
95 // From the GLES 3.1 spec:
96 // When a generic attribute array is sourced from client memory, the vertex attribute binding
97 // state is ignored. Thus we don't have to worry about binding state when using client memory
98 // attribs.
99 gl::AttributesMask mClientMemoryAttribsMask;
100 gl::AttributesMask mNullPointerClientMemoryAttribsMask;
101
102 // Used for validation cache. Indexed by attribute.
103 AttributesMask mCachedMappedArrayBuffers;
104 AttributesMask mCachedEnabledMappedArrayBuffers;
105};
106
107class VertexArray final : public angle::ObserverInterface,
108 public LabeledObject,
109 public angle::Subject
110{
111 public:
112 // Dirty bits for VertexArrays use a heirarchical design. At the top level, each attribute
113 // has a single dirty bit. Then an array of MAX_ATTRIBS dirty bits each has a dirty bit for
114 // enabled/pointer/format/binding. Bindings are handled similarly. Note that because the
115 // total number of dirty bits is 33, it will not be as fast on a 32-bit machine, which
116 // can't support the advanced 64-bit scanning intrinsics. We could consider packing the
117 // binding and attribute bits together if this becomes a problem.
118 //
119 // Special note on "DIRTY_ATTRIB_POINTER_BUFFER": this is a special case when the app
120 // calls glVertexAttribPointer but only changes a VBO and/or offset binding. This allows
121 // the Vulkan back-end to skip performing a pipeline change for performance.
122 enum DirtyBitType
123 {
124 DIRTY_BIT_ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER,
125 DIRTY_BIT_ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER_DATA,
126
127 // Dirty bits for attributes.
128 DIRTY_BIT_ATTRIB_0,
129 DIRTY_BIT_ATTRIB_MAX = DIRTY_BIT_ATTRIB_0 + gl::MAX_VERTEX_ATTRIBS,
130
131 // Dirty bits for bindings.
132 DIRTY_BIT_BINDING_0 = DIRTY_BIT_ATTRIB_MAX,
133 DIRTY_BIT_BINDING_MAX = DIRTY_BIT_BINDING_0 + gl::MAX_VERTEX_ATTRIB_BINDINGS,
134
135 // We keep separate dirty bits for bound buffers whose data changed since last update.
136 DIRTY_BIT_BUFFER_DATA_0 = DIRTY_BIT_BINDING_MAX,
137 DIRTY_BIT_BUFFER_DATA_MAX = DIRTY_BIT_BUFFER_DATA_0 + gl::MAX_VERTEX_ATTRIB_BINDINGS,
138
139 DIRTY_BIT_UNKNOWN = DIRTY_BIT_BUFFER_DATA_MAX,
140 DIRTY_BIT_MAX = DIRTY_BIT_UNKNOWN,
141 };
142
143 // We want to keep the number of dirty bits within 64 to keep iteration times fast.
144 static_assert(DIRTY_BIT_MAX <= 64, "Too many vertex array dirty bits.");
145
146 enum DirtyAttribBitType
147 {
148 DIRTY_ATTRIB_ENABLED,
149 DIRTY_ATTRIB_POINTER,
150 DIRTY_ATTRIB_FORMAT,
151 DIRTY_ATTRIB_BINDING,
152 DIRTY_ATTRIB_POINTER_BUFFER,
153 DIRTY_ATTRIB_UNKNOWN,
154 DIRTY_ATTRIB_MAX = DIRTY_ATTRIB_UNKNOWN,
155 };
156
157 enum DirtyBindingBitType
158 {
159 DIRTY_BINDING_BUFFER,
160 DIRTY_BINDING_DIVISOR,
161 DIRTY_BINDING_UNKNOWN,
162 DIRTY_BINDING_MAX = DIRTY_BINDING_UNKNOWN,
163 };
164
165 using DirtyBits = angle::BitSet<DIRTY_BIT_MAX>;
166 using DirtyAttribBits = angle::BitSet<DIRTY_ATTRIB_MAX>;
167 using DirtyBindingBits = angle::BitSet<DIRTY_BINDING_MAX>;
168 using DirtyAttribBitsArray = std::array<DirtyAttribBits, gl::MAX_VERTEX_ATTRIBS>;
169 using DirtyBindingBitsArray = std::array<DirtyBindingBits, gl::MAX_VERTEX_ATTRIB_BINDINGS>;
170
171 VertexArray(rx::GLImplFactory *factory,
172 VertexArrayID id,
173 size_t maxAttribs,
174 size_t maxAttribBindings);
175
176 void onDestroy(const Context *context);
177
178 VertexArrayID id() const { return mId; }
179
180 void setLabel(const Context *context, const std::string &label) override;
181 const std::string &getLabel() const override;
182
183 const VertexBinding &getVertexBinding(size_t bindingIndex) const;
184 const VertexAttribute &getVertexAttribute(size_t attribIndex) const;
185 const VertexBinding &getBindingFromAttribIndex(size_t attribIndex) const
186 {
187 return mState.getBindingFromAttribIndex(attribIndex);
188 }
189
190 // Returns true if the function finds and detaches a bound buffer.
191 bool detachBuffer(const Context *context, BufferID bufferID);
192
193 void setVertexAttribDivisor(const Context *context, size_t index, GLuint divisor);
194 void enableAttribute(size_t attribIndex, bool enabledState);
195
196 void setVertexAttribPointer(const Context *context,
197 size_t attribIndex,
198 Buffer *boundBuffer,
199 GLint size,
200 VertexAttribType type,
201 bool normalized,
202 GLsizei stride,
203 const void *pointer);
204
205 void setVertexAttribIPointer(const Context *context,
206 size_t attribIndex,
207 Buffer *boundBuffer,
208 GLint size,
209 VertexAttribType type,
210 GLsizei stride,
211 const void *pointer);
212
213 void setVertexAttribFormat(size_t attribIndex,
214 GLint size,
215 VertexAttribType type,
216 bool normalized,
217 bool pureInteger,
218 GLuint relativeOffset);
219 void bindVertexBuffer(const Context *context,
220 size_t bindingIndex,
221 Buffer *boundBuffer,
222 GLintptr offset,
223 GLsizei stride);
224 void setVertexAttribBinding(const Context *context, size_t attribIndex, GLuint bindingIndex);
225 void setVertexBindingDivisor(size_t bindingIndex, GLuint divisor);
226
227 Buffer *getElementArrayBuffer() const { return mState.getElementArrayBuffer(); }
228 size_t getMaxAttribs() const { return mState.getMaxAttribs(); }
229 size_t getMaxBindings() const { return mState.getMaxBindings(); }
230
231 const std::vector<VertexAttribute> &getVertexAttributes() const
232 {
233 return mState.getVertexAttributes();
234 }
235 const std::vector<VertexBinding> &getVertexBindings() const
236 {
237 return mState.getVertexBindings();
238 }
239
240 rx::VertexArrayImpl *getImplementation() const { return mVertexArray; }
241
242 const AttributesMask &getEnabledAttributesMask() const
243 {
244 return mState.getEnabledAttributesMask();
245 }
246
247 gl::AttributesMask getClientAttribsMask() const { return mState.mClientMemoryAttribsMask; }
248
249 bool hasEnabledNullPointerClientArray() const
250 {
251 return mState.hasEnabledNullPointerClientArray();
252 }
253
254 bool hasMappedEnabledArrayBuffer() const
255 {
256 return mState.mCachedEnabledMappedArrayBuffers.any();
257 }
258
259 const VertexArrayState &getState() const { return mState; }
260
261 bool isBufferAccessValidationEnabled() const { return mBufferAccessValidationEnabled; }
262
263 // Observer implementation
264 void onSubjectStateChange(angle::SubjectIndex index, angle::SubjectMessage message) override;
265
266 static size_t GetVertexIndexFromDirtyBit(size_t dirtyBit);
267
268 angle::Result syncState(const Context *context);
269 bool hasAnyDirtyBit() const { return mDirtyBits.any(); }
270
271 ComponentTypeMask getAttributesTypeMask() const { return mState.mVertexAttributesTypeMask; }
272 AttributesMask getAttributesMask() const { return mState.mEnabledAttributesMask; }
273
274 void onBindingChanged(const Context *context, int incr);
275 bool hasTransformFeedbackBindingConflict(const gl::Context *context) const;
276
277 ANGLE_INLINE angle::Result getIndexRange(const Context *context,
278 DrawElementsType type,
279 GLsizei indexCount,
280 const void *indices,
281 IndexRange *indexRangeOut) const
282 {
283 Buffer *elementArrayBuffer = mState.mElementArrayBuffer.get();
284 if (elementArrayBuffer && mIndexRangeCache.get(type, indexCount, indices, indexRangeOut))
285 {
286 return angle::Result::Continue;
287 }
288
289 return getIndexRangeImpl(context, type, indexCount, indices, indexRangeOut);
290 }
291
292 void setBufferAccessValidationEnabled(bool enabled)
293 {
294 mBufferAccessValidationEnabled = enabled;
295 }
296
297 private:
298 ~VertexArray() override;
299
300 // This is a performance optimization for buffer binding. Allows element array buffer updates.
301 friend class State;
302
303 void setDirtyAttribBit(size_t attribIndex, DirtyAttribBitType dirtyAttribBit);
304 void setDirtyBindingBit(size_t bindingIndex, DirtyBindingBitType dirtyBindingBit);
305
306 DirtyBitType getDirtyBitFromIndex(bool contentsChanged, angle::SubjectIndex index) const;
307 void setDependentDirtyBit(bool contentsChanged, angle::SubjectIndex index);
308
309 // These are used to optimize draw call validation.
310 void updateCachedBufferBindingSize(VertexBinding *binding);
311 void updateCachedTransformFeedbackBindingValidation(size_t bindingIndex, const Buffer *buffer);
312 void updateCachedMappedArrayBuffers(bool isMapped, const AttributesMask &boundAttributesMask);
313 void updateCachedMappedArrayBuffersBinding(const VertexBinding &binding);
314
315 angle::Result getIndexRangeImpl(const Context *context,
316 DrawElementsType type,
317 GLsizei indexCount,
318 const void *indices,
319 IndexRange *indexRangeOut) const;
320
321 void setVertexAttribPointerImpl(const Context *context,
322 ComponentType componentType,
323 bool pureInteger,
324 size_t attribIndex,
325 Buffer *boundBuffer,
326 GLint size,
327 VertexAttribType type,
328 bool normalized,
329 GLsizei stride,
330 const void *pointer);
331
332 // These two functions return true if the state was dirty.
333 bool setVertexAttribFormatImpl(VertexAttribute *attrib,
334 GLint size,
335 VertexAttribType type,
336 bool normalized,
337 bool pureInteger,
338 GLuint relativeOffset);
339 bool bindVertexBufferImpl(const Context *context,
340 size_t bindingIndex,
341 Buffer *boundBuffer,
342 GLintptr offset,
343 GLsizei stride);
344
345 VertexArrayID mId;
346
347 VertexArrayState mState;
348 DirtyBits mDirtyBits;
349 DirtyAttribBitsArray mDirtyAttribBits;
350 DirtyBindingBitsArray mDirtyBindingBits;
351 Optional<DirtyBits> mDirtyBitsGuard;
352
353 rx::VertexArrayImpl *mVertexArray;
354
355 std::vector<angle::ObserverBinding> mArrayBufferObserverBindings;
356
357 AttributesMask mCachedTransformFeedbackConflictedBindingsMask;
358
359 class IndexRangeCache final : angle::NonCopyable
360 {
361 public:
362 IndexRangeCache();
363
364 void invalidate() { mTypeKey = DrawElementsType::InvalidEnum; }
365
366 bool get(DrawElementsType type,
367 GLsizei indexCount,
368 const void *indices,
369 IndexRange *indexRangeOut)
370 {
371 size_t offset = reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(indices);
372 if (mTypeKey == type && mIndexCountKey == indexCount && mOffsetKey == offset)
373 {
374 *indexRangeOut = mPayload;
375 return true;
376 }
377
378 return false;
379 }
380
381 void put(DrawElementsType type,
382 GLsizei indexCount,
383 size_t offset,
384 const IndexRange &indexRange);
385
386 private:
387 DrawElementsType mTypeKey;
388 GLsizei mIndexCountKey;
389 size_t mOffsetKey;
390 IndexRange mPayload;
391 };
392
393 mutable IndexRangeCache mIndexRangeCache;
394 bool mBufferAccessValidationEnabled;
395};
396
397} // namespace gl
398
399#endif // LIBANGLE_VERTEXARRAY_H_
